intro: Papuastelma, commonly known as the velvet leaf or velvet plant, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its thick, velvety leaves that are often a deep green or reddish hue. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in racemes. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly the Amazon basin. Papuastelma is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and ability to thrive in humid environments.
